name: Dietrich Lubs
biography: Working for the German electronics and appliance manufacturer Braun since 1962, Dietrich Lubs became a senior member of its Design Department during a nearly 40-year career with the firm. He served as the deputy director of its Design Department from 1995 until retiring in 2001.  During his decades at Braun, Lubs’s work spanned a broad spectrum of products, ranging from graphics for audio equipment, kitchen appliances, and shavers, to designs for watches, hair dryers, and clocks. He collaborated with Dieter Rams on several products including ET calculators like the ET55.
